reviews.raw_text:
The hottest spot in USC village! We got Pastrami sandwitch, matcha latte and Hong Kong tea latte, the sandwitch is delicious !! full of meat and the portion is big.
The space inside the store is small and noisy, it's better eat outside, enjoying the sun and breeze.

I tried the breakfast burrito before, it's tasty too!
Definately would come back and try different meal next time.
Love Dulce as always <3

reviews.raw_text:
The line is always popping off and for good reason! I got the chicken peanut salad, which was massive in portion and so fresh and flavorful. ü•ó Also grabbed an americano (loved their espresso blend, bold but smooth) and a premium ceremonial-grade matcha with almond milk, which was actually so good ! Everything tasted high quality, and the vibes were lively with plenty of seating inside and outside. Definitely recommend stopping by if you‚Äôre at USC! ‚òï‚ù§Ô∏èüíõ

reviews.raw_text:
Cafe Dulce sandwiches and salads just hit different!!! I ordered the Spicy Chicken sandwich, which had herb-roasted chicken breast, tomatoes, house slaw, provolone & sweet chili sauce, and the Peanut Kale salad, which had fresh herbs, serrano, roasted peanut vinaigrette & grated reggiano. Everything was so fresh and delicious, especially the bread on the sandwich!!!! I appreciated that they had plenty of vegan options for my vegan friend, and can‚Äôt wait to come back and try other ones.

The line was worth the wait, and it wasn‚Äôt terribly bad. Went fairly quickly for a weekend crowd and food came out fast. The music inside was too loud for conversation, but there is a patio area and the food and service were excellent!

Price per person: $30‚Äì50
Food: 5
Service: 5
Atmosphere: 5
Seating type: Indoor dining area, Outdoor patio / terrace, Counter seating

When I ordered the cashier told the transaction did not go through and asked me to try again, I did and , I noticed They Double Charged me for a single order on my credit Card and when I let them know they said Oh sorry it will be refunded and returned automatically and it was a mistake. It is NOT ACCEPTABLE train people who take the order to know how to work with machines and how to handle the similar situation. It is not ETHICAL at all. I Double Charged and NEVER RECEIVED my money back.

reviews.raw_text:
The staff making the drinks are often rude- giving side eyes or acting annoyed if you ask for something simple like less ice.

They also don‚Äôt fill your drink to the top and tell you to pay an extra dollar if you want it full, claiming it‚Äôs written on the board.
When you don‚Äôt notice the sign, they show no patience to explain.

Instead of listening to feedback, they make excuses ‚Äî like saying there‚Äôs a matcha shortage ‚Äî yet still charge for ‚Äúpremium‚Äù quality that doesn‚Äôt deliver.

It‚Äôs disappointing to see this attitude, especially at a caf√© on the USC campus. There are plenty of other spots nearby where staff treat customers with empathy and patience. The real issue isn‚Äôt just the extra charge for less ice ‚Äî it‚Äôs the way the staff handled it.

reviews.raw_text:
The food is all good I‚Äôm sure you would be satisfied with anything on their menu, good place to grab food not horrible pricing for LA. However the service is very minimal but understandably, Cafe Dulce is always packed. So if you are looking for a sit down place this isn‚Äôt the one, this is great for to-go food or sitting outside in the village. They have amazing matcha and great options for anyone with a dietary restrictions with Vegan and gluten free options.

reviews.raw_text:
The food: Green Tea Roti is what my friend and I came here for. It was pretty good, although it did not have that matcha flavor, which, for me, was a good thing, as I don't like matcha-flavored anything but my friend was a bit disappointed, lol.
The service: The line runs out the door and they explicitly ask people to line outside so as to avoid the inside to get too crowded, I think that's a fantastic ideas as the outside has near limitless space (this Cafe Dulce is nested inside the USC Village, so there's PLENTY of room to make a line even almost half a mile long, lol.
The atmosphere: it was ok, I did like that one column that's full of stickers, it's very hipster and fits the criteria of being part of a vibrant and active college campus such as USC.

reviews.raw_text:
Love the breakfast burritos here. Come here every couple of months or so. Always polite service....but I have a question. How many Edan's walk up to the to go counter and say I have an order for Edan? Why would you get ready to give me my order and then pull back and ask me my last name?

How many random people walk in and say my name is Edan and I have a pick up order for a burrito. That left an extremely bad taste in my mouth and if I had time I would have went back and asked her why she asked what my last name is. How many black guys tell you their name is Edan?

I got the pastrami burger. It was amazing my friend got the pesto chicken sandwich and she liked her food as well. The Matcha is delicious and well-made with oat milk. I think they use pretty high grade Matcha. The salad was interesting with a pear on top but the pastrami sandwich was absolutely amazing and so flavorful Maybe I was just hungry, but it was so good. The ambience is really nice. The seats are comfortable plenty of seating areas indoor and outdoor the music is pretty interesting and the service is spot on.

reviews.raw_text:
Obviously a popular spot for the area. The queue is always long but move rather fast as I noticed most people were ordering matcha latte (I‚Äôm no exception) and they have premade it in a big dispenser so they get the orders out the door very quickly.

Matcha was very tasty, though on the sweet side, which I‚Äôm not complaining about. Coffee here isn‚Äôt exceptional but it gets us going. Breakfast burrito was very yummy with egg, potato, bacon, etc. inside - very flavorful.

The coffee shop gets busy so the seatings are hard to come by but we got lucky and got a table outside which was a bit chilly but very nice with the university atmosphere.

reviews.plain_text: My son‚Äôs first Dulce breakfast burrito (bacon and avo) and it was a hit! (Duh. Their breakfast burrito is bomb.) And their ‚ÄúJoe Pro‚Äù brewed coffee today is outstanding - one of the best drip coffees I‚Äôve had in a while. Love this place - and (bonus!) there was barely a line today. Check it out (even if you have to wait) - you won‚Äôt be disappointed.

reviews.raw_text:
The music at this cafe is obnoxiously LOUD. It leaves one with the general impression that Dulce employees and management do not care one little bit about customer experience and that they want you to scurry out clutching you $9 oatmilk matcha latte  as fast as possible. The loudness of their music has been consistent for years, whether it‚Äôs 9 in the morning or 3 in the afternoon. Save yourself the headache and go to a different coffee shop!

Atmosphere: 1

I always love getting dulce, especially today as I was having a rough day. I tell the worker at the register my order and they let me get through my whole order before rudely saying that ‚ÄúI didn‚Äôt hear any of that‚Äù. They then continued to be extremely rude when I explain that I had lost my voice and was sorry. They said ‚ÄúI‚Äôve had a long day I‚Äôm tired‚Äù  which I completely understand, however, was really disappointing to feel so unwelcome in a place I really enjoy going. Please think about others around you too especially those who give no reason to be mean.

reviews.raw_text:
For the past 3 years of my college life, Dulce has been incredible with their service and quality of food. However, the manager recently on 10/5/2024 was extremely disrespectful to me, speaking in a manner in which you would not use towards a customer.

I did an online order, and when asking about information, she was extremely rude in saying that I‚Äôve already been handed a refund and to ‚Äúeither get in line or nothing‚Äù due to their online system being down. Now, I do understand that they are busy and overworked, but the way she informed me about the online situation was incredibly rude.

reviews.raw_text:
Cafe Dulce at USC Village is a gem that stands out for its pretty good and unique pastries and drinks. This cafe has become a popular spot for students and visitors, offering a delightful array of treats and beverages that cater to diverse tastes.

One of the highlights of Cafe Dulce is their green tea donut, which features a rich matcha flavor that is both unique and satisfying1. Another favorite is the apple pie donut, combining the comforting flavors of apple pie with the convenience of a donut1. These pastries are not only delicious but also beautifully presented, making them a feast for both the eyes and the taste buds.

In addition to their pastries, Cafe Dulce offers a variety of drinks that perfectly complement their baked goods. The matcha latte and rose latte are highly recommended, providing a refreshing and flavorful experience1. For those looking for something different, the blueberry matcha latte offers a unique twist on the traditional matcha drink2. Their Vietnamese iced coffee is another standout, known for its strong and bold flavor2.

The atmosphere at Cafe Dulce is vibrant and welcoming, with a bustling environment that reflects its popularity. While seating can be limited due to the high number of students studying, the efficient service ensures that you won‚Äôt have to wait long to enjoy your treats2.

Overall, Cafe Dulce at USC Village is a must-visit for anyone looking to indulge in some unique and delicious pastries and drinks. Whether you‚Äôre a student in need of a study break or a visitor exploring the area, this cafe offers a delightful experience that is sure to satisfy your cravings.

Food: 5
Service: 5
Atmosphere: 5

Amazing food and drinks located right in USC village! In my personal opinion, this is the best restaurant and best coffee spot on campus and within reasonable proximity. Both the savory meal items and sweeter desserts were all excellent. Drinks also hit the spot. Definitely recommend it and thanks so much for the quality service even during busy shifts!

There was a waiting line out the door.

Blueberry Matcha Latte is quite good. $6 for smaller size; including tips.

Comparison of Matchas:
The Matcha at Sunlife is almost $10; as compared to $6 at Dulce and $7 at Soboyeyo.
Unfortunately, it seems like all the Matcha beverages come pre-sweetened at USC Village vendors. Bummer.

The blueberry matcha is an unexpected combination, but I like the subtle blueberry flavor and matcha flavor.

These were two recommended menus.

It's a flavor that keeps coming to mind!!

reviews.raw_text:
This was on March 22, 2024 @ 3:34PM  and I'm barely reviewing it June 30, 2024. I've been debating if I should post it or not, due to the fact that I work in the Village as well and don't want them to treat me WORST after this review.

Here we go:
Like mentioned before, I work in the Village and  see my co-workers, along w/ clients/customers always walking around w/ "the Green Drink" and I wanted to try it to see what the hype was about.  The hype was real. Matcha Tea is awesome!!

‚Ä¢1st time I was there, I ordered the Matcha (NO ICE), and a Salad w/ extra dressing. When I received my food, I was missing the extra vinaigrette I had ordered, so I asked the cashier if she had entered it on my order. She looked at me annoyed and asked someone else to get it for me.
I UNDERSTAND THEY ARE ALWAYS VERY BUSY, so I didn't think much of it and walked away happy w/ my Matcha Tea.

‚Ä¢2nd time, I brought my son to also try the Matcha tea.  Again, I asked for BOTH NO ICE PLEASE.
When they called my order, I saw both drinks had ice. The same cashier that helped me the 1st visit I made was now making the Tea and when I politely reminded her that I had requested BOTH DRINKS WITH NO ICE..... again, she gave me that LOOK and grabbed a big spoon and took the ice out.

Once the ice was out, the teas were almost down to half the cup. I thought she would refill that missing part.

...yeah right!! She rudely slammed the cups on the counter & kept going.

I wanted to go off on her so bad ecause this was my 2nd time there and both times the same Asian girl treated me poorly.
Since I was with my son; I walked away per his request.
LOOK AT THAT PUCTURE I POSTED & TELL ME IF THAT'S APPROPRIATE.

Meal type: Lunch
Price per person: $20‚Äì30
Food: 5
Service: 1
Atmosphere: 3

reviews.raw_text: amazing IF you know what to get. their breakfast sandwiches are phenomenal and super customizable. also, the matcha, specifically the iced blueberry, is phenomenal. they have pretty good lunch sandwiches and such, but i think their breakfast is significantly better. if you‚Äôre feeling like it, their green tea donut is possibly the best donut i‚Äôve ever had ‚Äî not overly sweet, and you can continue to function after eating it. i would personally not recommend getting their coffee, i haven‚Äôt found a version of it i enjoy, and there are better coffee spots in the area imo. also, line is usually really long, but you‚Äôll be shocked at how quickly it moves. usc staple!

reviews.raw_text:
My recent breakfast experience at Cafe Dulce in the USC food court was deeply disappointing and frankly, unacceptable. The most glaring issue was the shockingly inconsiderate behavior of the staff. In the middle of our meal, a staff member abruptly took chairs from right under us, forcing us to stand. This rude and disrespectful action compelled us to leave immediately, cutting our visit short.

Additionally, the overall service was remarkably slow, adding to our frustration. During what is usually a busy breakfast time, such inefficiency is particularly noticeable and inconvenient.

The cafe's seating situation was also dismal. Very limited seating was available, and the few spots that were, including the bar counter where we initially found space, were poorly maintained and unclean. The counter was stained and covered in cooking liquids, indicative of a lack of attention to cleanliness.

As for the food, the breakfast burrito I ordered was smaller than expected, which was disappointing. The only redeeming aspect of the visit was the coffee, which was actually quite good. However, this small positive was completely overshadowed by the unpleasant experience caused by the lack of clean seating and the appalling behavior of the staff.

In summary, while the coffee at Cafe Dulce might be commendable, the overall experience was ruined by slow service, inadequate and dirty seating, and, most notably, the disrespectful treatment by the staff. Such behavior is unacceptable in any customer service setting, and it's something that the management at Cafe Dulce needs to address urgently.

Food: 4
Service: 1
Atmosphere: 1

reviews.raw_text: This is for students. There were no seats available. Everybody was there with their laptops at the table for hours. The tables outside on the quad was just as crowded.  You will have to get your food to go. ‚Ä¶ More
